title: How to Set Up a Fitbit Flex

steps.title: Locate all of your Fitbit items.
steps.content: Locate all of your Fitbit items. You should have the following items when setting up your Fitbit Flex: Fitbit tracker (May be inserted in a wristband) USB charger USB Bluetooth dongle Two wristbands

steps.title: Charge your Fitbit tracker.
steps.content: Charge your Fitbit tracker. Before you setup your new Fitbit, make sure it has a charge: Remove the tracker from the wristband if necessary. Insert the tracker into the USB charger, round end first. Push the tracker down and in until you hear a click. Plug the charger into a USB port or wall adapter. Charge until at least three lights are on. This indicates a 60% charge.

steps.title: Visit the Fitbit Connect download page.
steps.content: Visit the Fitbit Connect download page. You can download the Fitbit Connect program for Windows or Mac by visiting fitbit.com/setup . This program will track your Fitbit information.

steps.title: Download the installer for your operating system.
steps.content: Download the installer for your operating system. If you scroll down the page a little, you should see a button for downloading the setup program. The website will attempt to detect your current operating system and provide the correct link. If the wrong button is showing, select your operating system underneath the Download button. Note: If you're using Windows 10, the Download button will take you to the Windows Store. Windows 10 uses the same app as the Windows Phone, so follow the method below after installing it. If you'd prefer to use the traditional Windows program, select "PC" as your operating system.

steps.title: Run the downloaded installer to install Fitbit Connect.
steps.content: Run the downloaded installer to install Fitbit Connect. Once the download is finished, run the installer and follow the prompts to install Fitbit Connect on your computer.

steps.title: Run Fitbit Connect and select "New to Fitbit."
steps.content: Run Fitbit Connect and select "New to Fitbit." This will allow you to create a new Fitbit account and setup your device. Note: If you have a previous Fitbit account, select "Existing User" to sign in with your existing account and setup your new Flex.

steps.title: Create a Fitbit account.
steps.content: Create a Fitbit account. You can enter in an email address and create a password, or you can sign in using your Facebook or Google account.

steps.title: Enter your personal information.
steps.content: Enter your personal information. Fitbit will use this to help track your performance. Enter your name, gender, birthday, height, and select your time zone.

steps.title: Select "Flex" from the list of devices.
steps.content: Select "Flex" from the list of devices. This will allow you to start setting up your Flex.

steps.title: Insert the tracker back in the wristband.
steps.content: Insert the tracker back in the wristband. Insert it into the wristband with the arrow facing out and pointing towards the black band. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Put the bracelet on.
steps.content: Put the bracelet on. Attach the wristband to your wrist using the clasp. The wristband should be snug but not constricting.

steps.title: Insert the USB Bluetooth dongle into a USB port on your computer.
steps.content: Insert the USB Bluetooth dongle into a USB port on your computer. You won't be able to continue with the Setup process until it's been inserted. This isn't required for computer's that already have Bluetooth capability.

steps.title: Wait while your Flex tracker pairs with your computer.
steps.content: Wait while your Flex tracker pairs with your computer. It may take a moment for your computer to find your tracker.

steps.title: Tap the flat part of your Flex twice when two lights appear.
steps.content: Tap the flat part of your Flex twice when two lights appear. Once the tracker has connected, you'll see two indicator lights on the black band. Tap your wristband twice and you'll feel the tracker vibrate.

steps.title: Start using your Flex.
steps.content: Start using your Flex. Your Flex is now setup, and the initial goal of 10,000 steps will start. You can check your progress by double-tapping your Flex. Each light indicates 20% of your goal.

steps.title: Visit your dashboard.
steps.content: Visit your dashboard. Once your device is synced, you can view your data from your Fitbit dashboard. You can use this to log activities, food, and track your progress towards your goals. You can open your dashboard any time at fitbit.com/login using your Fitbit account.

steps.title: Download the Fitbit app for your mobile device.
steps.content: Download the Fitbit app for your mobile device. This app is available for free for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone. You can get it from your device's Play Store. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Insert the tracker into your wristband and put it on.
steps.content: Insert the tracker into your wristband and put it on. Insert the tracker so that the arrow is facing out and pointing towards the black band on the wristband.

steps.title: Launch the app and tap "Join Fitbit."
steps.content: Launch the app and tap "Join Fitbit." This will start the account creation and device setup process. If you already created an account while setting up your Fitbit on your computer, log in with your Fitbit account instead.

steps.title: Wait for the app to find your device.
steps.content: Wait for the app to find your device. This may take a moment.

steps.title: Tap "Fitbit Flex" in the list of available devices.
steps.content: Tap "Fitbit Flex" in the list of available devices. This will start the setup process for the Flex.

steps.title: Tap "Set up your Flex."
steps.content: Tap "Set up your Flex." This will begin the account creation process.

steps.title: Create an account.
steps.content: Create an account. You can enter an email address and password, or you can use your Facebook or Google account to create one.

steps.title: Enter your personal information.
steps.content: Enter your personal information. You'll be prompted to enter your name, birthday, height, weight, and gender. Your age, height, weight, and gender are used to calculate your BMR (basal metabolic rate).

steps.title: Pair your device.
steps.content: Pair your device. Follow the prompts to pair your Fitbit tracker with your mobile device. Note: If you're using the Windows 10 app on a computer that doesn't have Bluetooth, you'll need to insert the USB Bluetooth dongle. If your phone is already paired with another device, such as a headset or your computer, you may not be able to pair the Fitbit.

steps.title: Wait while your Flex finishes setting up.
steps.content: Wait while your Flex finishes setting up. This may take a while to complete. Make sure to leave the app open while it sets up.

steps.title: View your dashboard.
steps.content: View your dashboard. Once setup is complete, you'll be taken to the Fitbit dashboard. This tracks your progress and allows you to adjust your goals. You can access the dashboard at any time by launching the Fitbit app.

steps.title: Make sure you have at least a 60% charge.
steps.content: Make sure you have at least a 60% charge. Plug your tracker into the charger and make sure at least three of the lights are on. For best results, charge it until all five lights are on.

steps.title: Try restarting your tracker if you can't pair or sync.
steps.content: Try restarting your tracker if you can't pair or sync. If your tracker stops functioning properly, a reset will usually fix it. This won't delete any of the data on the tracker. Plug the USB charging cable into a USB port. Insert the tracker into the charging unit. Use a paper clip to press and hold the pin hole on the back of the charger for about four seconds.

steps.title: Restart the setup process if it doesn't pair.
steps.content: Restart the setup process if it doesn't pair. If the setup process fails, you may want to try again from the beginning. Uninstall the Fitbit Connect program or app and then download and install it again. Follow the prompts to try setting up your device.

steps.title: Try another device.
steps.content: Try another device. If you can't get your Fitbit to connect to your computer, try setting it up with a mobile device, or vice-versa.
